page.title: 11CAR PARKING IN DENBIGH.
page.content: {Car parking}problems are a regular topic for discussion among local residents,{Clwyd County Council}and the{Denbigh Chamber of Trade.}The increasing volume of traffic entering the town has an adverse effect on custom say the Chamber of Trade.They claim that{motorists}are more likely to use shopping areas where there is easy parking.A count of traffic entering and leaving Denbigh during 1 hour on{Friday 12th July}showed that 645 cars left Denbigh and{771}entered. Car parking space exists for approx. 500 cars.With the trend to more car ownership it seems that the solution lies in building a single large car park (possibly multi storey) on land as close as possible to the town centre.The most likely area which has been considered is the land presently occupied by the{animal market.
